intro: Echites canescens, commonly known as the hairy echites, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Echites canescens is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it access water. It is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy, resilient species.
